tweets.text: Checked on lake as reports of oil in river. Residue along edge of lake, may just be flood run off from drains but to safe reported to @EnvAgencySE , also asking people not to feed birds in area. Please let EA know what you see. @Thames21 @GreenGreenwich @qwag @ElthamEnviros https://t.co/U9mheTxQDz

It's LGBT+ History Month! We're proud to support our LGBT+ staff.

Our @LGBTHM staff network will be running events on this year's theme of Mind, Body & Spirit to help staff remain connected, even when we can't celebrate in person like we did here in 2017.

#LGBTHM21 | #TeamEA https://t.co/OBRaadM0Nf

.@EmmaHowardBoyd welcomes the Dasgupta Review which calls to change how we measure economic success and invest more in nature recovery.

Read about how nature and economics go hand in hand here: https://t.co/bIqFgizzMa

#TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/ZVChGBFYgV

tweets.text: Really proud of this large pond created near Keswick last year, providing both natural flood management and habitat benefits - island and clean gravels for nesting birds, plus wildflowers for pollinators. We aim to build 7 more this summer! #WorldWetlandsDay @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/yLFB61o38p

We're carrying out some essential vegetation removal in the #Clifton area of #York so we can set up work to start making improvements to the Clifton Ings barrier bank. For more information on this work, contact the team at yorkfloodplan@environment-agency.gov.uk #YorkFAS https://t.co/adzA9LphTd

tweets.text: Today crews from Walton have been working with our colleges from the @EnvAgencySE  to place temporary flood defences being erected along the Thames from Desborough island through to Weybridge marina. Barriers are in place to limit flooding of the area over the next few days https://t.co/QiUrZddXD4

@JimScarratt @EnvAgency The EA forget that they used to be called the National Rivers Authority, put in place to maintain mostly manmade drainage channels, called rivers! You don't maintain something by neglecting it, but it leaves money to pay ivory tower salaries if it is 'saved' on the ground.......
We only had 7mm!  Lt Ouse over the bank upto the railway line! Surely the @EnvAgency should be dredging rivers?! https://t.co/9zKp9MtrUv

Hushed up in the 90s, #Capperpass since admitted their actions of dumping tonnes of contaminated over the area. The long lasting affects have been found through an @EnvAgency research project in the area, which found toxins & heavy metals. Why are they churning up the soil? https://t.co/ANFGzlYwHj
